system

Interface Computer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputerImpl

    public interface Computer
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Interface for a computer that is able to receive a task implementation and execute it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> void compute(Task<T> t) 
      <T> void execute(Task<T> t)
      Execute function for a task.
      void exit()
      Exits the computer
      <T> void setArg(java.util.UUID id, T r)
      setArg sets results to subtasks.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        <T> void execute(Task<T> t)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Execute function for a task.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Specified return value for task to be executed.
        Parameters:
        t - Object input of a specific task.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • compute

        <T> void compute(Task<T> t)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException

        > - t The task to be computed.

      • setArg

        <T> void setArg(java.util.UUID id,
                T r)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        setArg sets results to subtasks. The argument is sent to the parent task which handles what it should do with it.
        Type Parameters:
        UUID - id The Id of the task.
        T - r The result
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • exit

        void exit()
   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Exits the computer
        Throws:
